Module nl.naturalis.common
Package nl.naturalis.common.time

Class FuzzyDate

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.naturalis.common.time.FuzzyDate
  • public final class FuzzyDate
extends Object
    A FuzzyDate represents the result of parsing a date string into a date/time object. You obtain a FuzzyDate by calling FuzzyDateParser.parse(String). The instance returned by the parser is guaranteed to have at least a known year. Month, day, hour, minute, second and time zone may or may not be known. If the parser could not extract a year from the date string a FuzzyDateException is thrown.

    Although any number of date/time patterns can be used to parse date strings into date/time objects, FuzzyDate works best when they are composed of the usual date fields: YEAR, MONTH_OF_YEAR, DAY_OF_MONTH, HOUR_OF_DAY, MINUTE_OF_HOUR, SECOND_OF_MINUTE, NANO_OF_SECOND, ZoneOffset and ZoneId. It may not be accurate when composed of more exotic date fields like DAY_OF_YEAR or SECOND_OF_DAY.

    A simple example of the workflow and capabilities of FuzzyDate and friends: 

     ParseInfo info1 = new ParseInfo("yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss");
 ParseInfo info2 = new ParseInfo("yyyy-MM-dd");
 FuzzyDateParser parser = new FuzzyDateParser(info1, info2);
 String dateString = "2020-09-18";
 FuzzyDate fuzzyDate = parser.parse(dateString);
 assertTrue(fuzzyDate.isTimeFuzzy());
 assertFalse(fuzzyDate.isDateFuzzy());
 assertSame(LocalDate.class, fuzzyDate.bestMatch().getClass());
 assertSame(info2, fuzzyDate.getParseInfo());
 OffsetDateTime realDate = fuzzyDate.toOffsetDateTime();

      • toInstant

        public Instant toInstant()
        Converts this FuzzyDate to an Instant. Month and day are set to 1 if unknown. Hour, minute and second are set to 0 if unknown. The time zone is set to UTC if unknown.
        Returns:
        The Instant most closely corresponding to this FuzzyDate

      • toInstant

        Parameters:
        zone - The ZoneOffset to use if no ZoneOffset could be extracted from the date string
        Returns:
        The Instant most closely corresponding to this FuzzyDate

      • bestMatch

        public TemporalAccessor bestMatch()
        Returns a date/time object whose type depends on the actual granularity of this FuzzyDate. See bestMatch(ZoneOffset).
        Returns:
        A date/time object whose type depends on the actual granularity of this FuzzyDate

      • bestMatch

        public TemporalAccessor bestMatch​(ZoneOffset timeZone)
        Returns a date/time object whose type depends on the actual granularity of this FuzzyDate. This method will always return one of the following types:

        • OffsetDateTime
        • LocalDateTime
        • LocalDate
        • YearMonth
        • Year

        If the raw TemporalAccessor encapsulated by this FuzzyDate already is an instance of one of these types, it will simply be returned as-is. If it is an instance of a ZonedDateTime, it will be converted to an OffsetDateTime. Otherwise a subclass of TemporalAccessor will be assembled whose granularity depends on the availability of MONTH_OF_YEAR, DAY_OF_MONTH, HOUR_OF_DAY, MINUTE_OF_HOUR, SECOND_OF_MINUTE, NANO_OF_SECOND, ZoneOffset and ZoneId. More exotic date fields like ChronoField.DAY_OF_WEEK are not considered.

        Returns:
        A date/time object whose type depends on the actual granularity of this FuzzyDate

      • getTemporalAccessor

        public TemporalAccessor getTemporalAccessor()
        Returns the raw TemporalAccessor object that was created from the verbatim date string.
        Returns:
        An instance of TemporalAccessor

      • isDateFuzzy

        public boolean isDateFuzzy()
        Returns whether or not the date of this instance is fuzzy. Returns true if either month or day is unknown, false if both are known.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the date of this instance is fuzzy

      • isTimeFuzzy

        public boolean isTimeFuzzy()
        Returns whether or not the time of this instance is fuzzy. Returns true if either the hour or the minute is unknown, false if both are known. Seconds are ignored, so time is not regarded as fuzzy if hour and minute are known but the second is not.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the date of this instance is fuzzy

      • isFuzzy

        public boolean isFuzzy()
        Returns whether or not the date or time is fuzzy. Equivalent to isDateFuzzy() || isTimeFuzzy().
        Returns:
        Whether or not the date and/or time is fuzzy.
